title: Print, Pareja turista, portafolio Estampas de San Juan, Centro de Arte Puertorriqueño (Tourist Couple, Vignettes of San Juan Portfolio, Center for Puerto Rican Art), 1952
title_raw: Pareja turista, portafolio Estampas de San Juan, Centro de Arte Puertorriqueño (Tourist Couple, Vignettes of San Juan Portfolio, Center for Puerto Rican Art)
signed: Signed in graphite, lower right: Homar 52; in white ink, lower left center of composition: Homar '52
provenance: Edwin S. Burdell; 1954: acquired by Museum
description: Vertical format. In shades of red, small group of American tourists in foreground, man and woman at front right. Man wears a shirt patterned with fish, striped pants, and a red cap with "I like IKE" printed in black on a white circle. He holds a camera at his chest. Woman wearing sunglasses, striped shirt, flowered skirt, earrings, and bracelets clutches a small purse. View at upper left through an arch of a historic street in Old San Juan, blue-glazed brick road with buildings on either side and a church in the background. A car drives in the street towards the church. Newsboy holding newspapers and other pedestrians in middleground. Another figure stands on a wrought-iron balcony. Framing border made up of repeating patern of green circles with smaller red circles within, each surrounded by four white dots. Outside this border, several concentric rectangles complete the frame.

tombstone.epitaph: Print, Pareja turista, portafolio Estampas de San Juan, Centro de Arte Puertorriqueño (Tourist Couple, Vignettes of San Juan Portfolio, Center for Puerto Rican Art), 1952; Designed by Lorenzo Homar (American, born Puerto Rico, 1913 - 2004); USA; screenprint on white paper; H x W: 35.3 × 27.5 cm (13 7/8 × 10 13/16 in.); 1954-17-4
